titlestmt.titleproper: Texas Sheet Music collection, Inclusive: 1836-1979, undated

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Texas Sheet Music collection
did.abstract: The Texas Sheet Music collection is an artificial assortment of songs and sheet music related to the state of Texas. Many of these songs pertain to the Texas War of Independence, famous military leaders, Christmas in Texas, the state flower, the state song, the city of Waco, and life in the American Southwest.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Texas Sheet Music collection is an artificial collection created over time by The Texas Collection staff from many different sources. All of the songs herein relate back to the central theme of the collection: life in Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Texas Sheet Music collection is an artificial collection created by The Texas Collection through various gifts and purchases. The contents range in chronology from the Texas Revolutionary period (1836) to 1979 with some undated pieces.

Series I. Compositions is the only series found in this collection. It is comprised of songs and sheet music pertaining to life in Texas. Some of the more prominent themes that recur throughout the materials include the Texas Revolution, the Mexican-American War, World War I, patriotism, Christmas in Texas, the state flower, the state song, the state flag, the city of Waco, the Cotton Palace, and life in the Southwest. The materials in this collection are in average condition.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to this latest round of processing, the Texas Sheet Music collection was housed in acid-free folders and boxes. The materials were organized alphabetically by title with multiple songs in each folder. There were no song titles or inclusive dates initially, but much of the preservation work had already been completed.

This original order has been maintained with the addition of each song title and the date range of each folder now included. All the songs are arranged alphabetically in a single series, I. Compositions.
In September 2017, all the sheet music related specifically to Baylor University was transferred into a new artificial collection, the BU Records: Baylor Sheet Music collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Texas Sheet Music collection, Accession #258, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Thomas DeShong. Released on 2017-11-14.

did.unittitle: Compositions

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series I. Compositions, the only series in the Texas Sheet Music collection, consists of songs and scores related to the state of Texas. The themes represented in this collection are quite diverse with particular emphasis on the Texas War for Independence, the Mexican-American War, Christmas in Texas, the city of Waco, patriotism, and life in the American Southwest. The contents of this series are arranged alphabetically by title and are in average condition.
